intro: Pelea wainihaensis, commonly known as the Wainiha Mountain Pelea, is a flowering plant native to the Hawaiian Islands. It is a member of the Rubiaceae family, which includes coffee and gardenias. The plant is characterized by its small, fragrant white flowers that bloom in clusters. It typically grows in moist, shaded environments on mountain slopes. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
